title: Trump’s Threat of More Tariffs Slows Trade Deals
summary: As America’s largest trading partners race toward deals, they are increasingly worried about being hit with future tariffs on their critical industries.

title: Here Are the Republican Senators Who May Revolt on Trump’s Bill
summary: Senate Republicans can afford to lose no more than three of their own votes on the bill, but two already are opposed and others remained undecided.

title: Trump Vowed to Dismantle MS-13. His Deal With Bukele Threatens That Effort.
summary: Top gang leaders being sent back to El Salvador were part of a lengthy federal investigation that has amassed evidence of a corrupt pact between the Bukele government and MS-13.

title: Trump Administration Finds Harvard Failed to Address Harassment of Jewish Students on Campus
summary: The university had recently restarted talks with the White House regarding a potential deal after months of fighting in court.

title: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear Major Campaign Finance Challenge
summary: The case involves a challenge to federal limits on how much political parties can spend in coordination with candidates.

title: Judge Amir Ali Has One of the Hardest Jobs In Washington
summary: Amir Ali joined D.C.’s court of appeals just weeks before Trump took office. It’s been tumultuous ever since.

title: ‘The Bomb Lady’ and the Forerunner of the ‘Bunker Buster’ Used in Iran
summary: While a child in wartime Vietnam, Anh Duong vowed to one day help the soldiers who saved her. She and her Navy team helped revolutionize American munitions.

title: Idaho Sniper Shooting Leaves 2 Firefighters Dead
summary: Firefighters were responding to a blaze in the panhandle of Idaho when the shooting happened, a sheriff said. The body of a suspect was recovered on Sunday evening.

title: Suspected Gunman Found Dead After Shooting 2 Firefighters in Idaho: What We Know
summary: The authorities said a gunman started a wildfire to lure firefighters, then ambushed them in a sniper attack.

title: 8 Key Text Exchanges at the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial
summary: The words sent between the mogul and his girlfriends have been cited as crucial evidence by both sides in a case that turns on whether sex marathons he directed were coercive.

title: Jury in Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial Begins Deliberations
summary: The panel of 12 must decide whether the music mogul is guilty of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking.

title: A Common Assumption About Aging May Be Wrong, Study Suggests
summary: Experts have long pointed to inflammation as a natural part of getting older. But a new paper suggests it might be more a product of our environment.

title: Democrats Lay Groundwork for a ‘Project 2029’
summary: The plan to write a policy agenda for the next Democratic president is at the center of a raging debate within the party: whether its biggest problem is its ideas or its difficulty in selling them.

title: Europe Is Making a Big Mistake
summary: Breakneck rearmament risks taking the European Union not forward but backward.

title: Corporate Politics
summary: We take a look at why businesses are turning away from political causes.

title: Inside the Roosevelt, a Migrant Shelter No More, Echoes of a Crisis
summary: The Midtown Manhattan hotel opened as a shelter in 2023. That mission has ended as border crossings plummet, slowing the flow of migrants.

title: Violence Erupts Between Israeli Settlers and Military in West Bank
summary: Hard-right activists clashed with troops and set fire to a security site following a growing wave of attacks on Palestinians in the occupied territory.

title: NYC Legal Aid Society Lawyers Threaten to Strike for Higher Pay
summary: The lawyers who represent the city’s poorest defendants want to be paid on par with their federal counterparts. They last walked out in 1994.
